caption.p: Detection of ZIKV transcytosis. (A) Fluorescence intensity profiles of elution from a Sephadex G-25 size-exclusion column is shown. An Atto647N-ZIKV particle was purified within the fraction layer 6 to 10 from gel filtration (solid squares). No fluorescence signal was detected in Atto647N-free ZIKV (solid triangles) within the same fraction layers. The 40 nm fluorescence microspheres were used as a size marker (solid circles). (B) Plaque assays were performed to determine the infectivity of the Atto647N-ZIKV. Dye-free ZIKV was used as a control. Both virus samples were purified from the same fractions of the Sephadex G-25 column. (C) Atto647N-ZIKV was used to validate virus crossing efficiency in JEG-3 and hCMEC/D3 barriers at 37 or 4 Â°C. (D) FITC-dextran was used to validate the permeability of JEG-3 and hCMEC/D3 barriers in (C) condition. The error bars represent standard deviations from three independent experiments. ** p < 0.01, *** p < 0.001.
